materials: Batteries (Rechargeable); CD/DVD/Blu-ray/UHD discs; Cell Phone Batteries; Cell Phones; Computer (Recycling); Hard Drives; Computer Monitors; Cameras; DVD Players/Blu-Ray Players/DVRs; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Memory (RAM), Flash Card/Drive; Microwaves; MP3 Players; Computer Peripherals; Portable Media Players; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Projectors; Satellite Components; Small Electronics; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; VCRs; VHS & Cassette Tapes; Video Game Systems; Wire; Electric Motors; Calculator
notes: Ogle County residents may recycle electronics on the last Friday of each month.  Limit 2 TVs or computer monitors each visit. $10 fee per microwave oven.

name: USPS Post Office Box Lobby Recycling Program
materials: Catalogs; Greeting Cards; Magazines; Paper (Mixed)

name: US Post Office
materials: Inkjet Printer Cartridges; Cables & Connectors; Cell Phones; Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; DVD Players/Blu-Ray Players/DVRs; Electronics; Laptop Computers; MP3 Players; Computer Peripherals; Portable Media Players; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Electronics; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; VCRs; Video Game Systems; Blu-Ray Players; Digital Converter Boxes; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: Free, postage-paid Mail Back envelopes can be found on display in the lobby. There is no limit to the number of envelopes customers may take. The contents of the envelope must weigh less than 13 ounces and the envelope must be able to seal completely. For more details visitMaxBack."

name: Call2Recycle at the Home Depot
materials: Cell Phones; Compact Fluorescent Lights; Ni-Cd Batteries; Li-Ion Batteries; Ni-MH Batteries; Ni-Zn Batteries; Small Sealed Lead Acid Batteries; Cables & Connectors; Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; DVD Players/Blu-Ray Players/DVRs; Electronics; Laptop Computers; MP3 Players; Computer Peripherals; Portable Media Players; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Electronics; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; VCRs; Video Game Systems; Blu-Ray Players; Digital Converter Boxes; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles; Batteries (Rechargeable); Cell Phone Batteries; Li-Ion Batteries; Ni-Cd Batteries; Ni-MH Batteries; Small Sealed Lead Acid Batteries
notes: The Home Depot accepts used rechargeable batteries and compact fluorescent bulbs. Look for the orange drop boxes, usually located near the front entrance near the customer service desk, or ask a store associate for more details.
